China Chem.1674-72911869-1870SP Science China PressHeidelbergs11426-012-4581-2458110.1007/s11426-012-4581-2ArticlesObservation of the novel “three-pointed star” cage-like (H2O)5 cluster in a polymeric solid {[Ag2(bpp)2(H2O)2](chd)·9H2O}nLuoGengGeng1XiongHongBo1FuZhiYong2DaiJingCao1dgrid.411404.4000000008895903XInstitute of Materials Physical ChemistryHuaqiao University361021XiamenChinagrid.79703.3a0000000417643838School of Chemistry and Chemical EngineeringSouth China University of Technology510640GuangzhouChinadjc@hqu.edu.cn8520121020125510210421148520121212201129122011852012© Science China Press and Springer-Verlag Berlin Heidelberg 20122012Abstract

Coordination polymeric solid, {[Ag2(bpp)2(H2O)2](chd)·9H2O}n (1) (bpp = 1,3-bis(4-pyridyl) propane, H2chd = 1,4-cyclo-hexanedicarboxylic acid), has been obtained by the solution phase ultrasonic synthesis techniques. The structure established through X-ray structural analysis shows that the compound traps an interesting 1D water tape built by the alternating “three-pointed star” cage-like pentameric and D2h tetrameric clusters (C2/c, Z = 4; a = 30.37(2) Å, b = 9.271(5) Å, and c = 18.89(1) Å; β = 128.47°; V = 4164(4) Å3). The novelty of the present complex is the rarely crystallographic example of the cage-shaped water pentamer, which is usually ascribed to a less-stable species. A first-principle density functional theory (DFT) calculation demonstrates that the interconnectivity between cage-like pentamers and D2h tetramers is beneficial for contribution to the structural stabilization of these less-stable water cluster species.

China Chem.1674-72911869-1870SP Science China PressHeidelbergs11426-012-4581-2458110.1007/s11426-012-4581-2ArticlesObservation of the novel "three-pointed star" cage-like (H2O)5 cluster in a polymeric solid {[Ag2(bpp)2(H2O)2](chd)⋅9H2O}nLuoGengGeng1XiongHongBo1FuZhiYong2DaiJingCao1d1grid.411404.4000000008895903XInstitute of Materials Physical ChemistryHuaqiao University361021XiamenChina2grid.79703.3a0000000417643838School of Chemistry and Chemical EngineeringSouth China University of Technology510640GuangzhouChinaddjc@hqu.edu.cn8520121020125510210421148520121212201129122011852012© Science China Press and Springer-Verlag Berlin Heidelberg 20122012AbstractCoordination polymeric solid, {[Ag2(bpp)2(H2O)2](chd)⋅9H2O}n (1) (bpp = 1,3-bis(4-pyridyl) propane, H2chd = 1,4-cyclo-hexanedicarboxylic acid), has been obtained by the solution phase ultrasonic synthesis techniques. The structure established through X-ray structural analysis shows that the compound traps an interesting 1D water tape built by the alternating "three-pointed star" cage-like pentameric and D2h tetrameric clusters (C2/c, Z = 4; a = 30.37(2) Å, b = 9.271(5) Å, and c = 18.89(1) Å; β = 128.47°; V = 4164(4) Å3). The novelty of the present complex is the rarely crystallographic example of the cage-shaped water pentamer, which is usually ascribed to a less-stable species. A first-principle density functional theory (DFT) calculation demonstrates that the interconnectivity between cage-like pentamers and D2h tetramers is beneficial for contribution to the structural stabilization of these less-stable water cluster species.Keywordswater clusterwater elements.content: Coordination polymeric solid, {[Ag2(bpp)2(H2O)2](chd)·9H2O}n (1) (bpp = 1,3-bis(4-pyridyl) propane, H2chd = 1,4-cyclo-hexanedicarboxylic acid), has been obtained by the solution phase ultrasonic synthesis techniques. The structure established through X-ray structural analysis shows that the compound traps an interesting 1D water tape built by the alternating “three-pointed star” cage-like pentameric and D2h tetrameric clusters (C2/c, Z = 4; a = 30.37(2) Å, b = 9.271(5) Å, and c = 18.89(1) Å; β = 128.47°; V = 4164(4) Å3). The novelty of the present complex is the rarely crystallographic example of the cage-shaped water pentamer, which is usually ascribed to a less-stable species. A first-principle density functional theory (DFT) calculation demonstrates that the interconnectivity between cage-like pentamers and D2h tetramers is beneficial for contribution to the structural stabilization of these less-stable water cluster species.

Abstract

Coordination polymeric solid, {[Ag2(bpp)2(H2O)2](chd)⋅9H2O}n (1) (bpp = 1,3-bis(4-pyridyl) propane, H2chd = 1,4-cyclo-hexanedicarboxylic acid), has been obtained by the solution phase ultrasonic synthesis techniques. The structure established through X-ray structural analysis shows that the compound traps an interesting 1D water tape built by the alternating "three-pointed star" cage-like pentameric and D2h tetrameric clusters (C2/c, Z = 4; a = 30.37(2) Å, b = 9.271(5) Å, and c = 18.89(1) Å; β = 128.47°; V = 4164(4) Å3). The novelty of the present complex is the rarely crystallographic example of the cage-shaped water pentamer, which is usually ascribed to a less-stable species. A first-principle density functional theory (DFT) calculation demonstrates that the interconnectivity between cage-like pentamers and D2h tetramers is beneficial for contribution to the structural stabilization of these less-stable water cluster species.
